publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4291 Alison McInnes: Peacock Visual Arts’s 35th Anniversary—That the Parliament congratulates Peacock Visual Arts on reaching its 35th anniversary; notes the outstanding work that Peacock does in the arts in Aberdeen and across the north east, including working to develop the skills of artists, helping young people get involved with new media and film-making and hosting an extensive exhibition programme as well as running community projects; acknowledges the funding and support provided by the Scottish Arts Council, Scottish Screen and Aberdeen City Council, and hopes that all partners will continue to work together to ensure that Peacock can go from strength to strength and continue delivering its outstanding programme for the next 35 years and beyond.
S3M-4291 Peacock Visual Arts’s 35th Anniversary (lodged on 2 June 2009) Lewis Macdonald*

S3M-4291 Alison McInnes: Peacock Visual Arts’s 35th Anniversary—That the Parliament congratulates Peacock Visual Arts on reaching its 35th anniversary; notes the outstanding work that Peacock does in the arts in Aberdeen and across the north east, including working to develop the skills of artists, helping young people get involved with new media and film-making and hosting an extensive exhibition programme as well as running community projects; acknowledges the funding and support provided by the Scottish Arts Council, Scottish Screen and Aberdeen City Council, and hopes that all partners will continue to work together to ensure that Peacock can go from strength to strength and continue delivering its outstanding programme for the next 35 years and beyond. Supported by: Lewis Macdonald
S3M-4291 Peacock Visual Arts’s 35th Anniversary (lodged on 2 June 2009) Nanette Milne*, Karen Whitefield*
